Description: Sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; white slip; interior: two black-figure friezes separated by broad band with added red band lined in white; to the outside part of bird to left, to the inside part of tall palmette; added red for details; exterior reserved with mouldings at top and bottom.
Curator's comments: Probably from same plate as 1924,1201.222. Both may belong with 1888,0601.395a-c.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.794)
